newsitem.title: TAIWAN: More than 12,000 Taiwan people take mass dip.
newsitem.headline: More than 12,000 Taiwan people take mass dip.

text.p: More than 12,000 people swam across Taiwan's scenic Sun Moon Lake on Sunday in an attempt to set a new world record, state television reported.
"A total of 12,243 people participated and completed this magnificent task," the television said.
Swimmers aged between four and 82 took part in the mass swim across the four-km (2.5 mile) mountain lake in the central county of Nantou.
Organisers said they hoped the event would set a new Guinness record. They did not say what the previous record was.
